comments:
Build: 3.1 RC1  Linux-GTK-SuSe 9 - Konqueror 
 
Launch on a fresh workspace 
Dismiss Intro 
Create a new plugin project. 
You will see the following in your log by Intro: 
 
Error 2005-05-30 02:39:40.655 Failed to create Intro UI implementation from: 
implementation element with kind="html" in extension: 
org.eclipse.ui.intro.config in Bundle: org.eclipse.platform 
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path 
(MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)] 
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2966) 
at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:130) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.intro.impl.presentations.BrowserIntroPartImplementation.createPartControl(BrowserIntroPartImplementation.java:91)

at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchIntroManager.createIntro(WorkbenchIntroManager.java:162) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchIntroManager.showIntro(WorkbenchIntroManager.java:112) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.application.WorkbenchWindowAdvisor.openIntro(WorkbenchWindowAdvisor.java:169) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEWorkbenchWindowAdvisor.openIntro(IDEWorkbenchWindowAdvisor.java:421)

org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.busyOpenWorkbenchWindow(Workbench.java:676) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.doOpenFirstTimeWindow(Workbench.java:1277) 
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.access$10(Workbench.java:1275) 
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$14.run(Workbench.java:1231) 
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench$15.run(Workbench.java:1262) 
at 
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.runInCurrentThread(ModalContext.java:346) 
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext.run(ModalContext.java:291) 
at 
org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.ProgressMonitorDialog.run(ProgressMonitorDialog.java:447) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runStartupWithProgress(Workbench.java:1253) 
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.openFirstTimeWindow(Workbench.java:1229) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchConfigurer.openFirstTimeWindow(WorkbenchConfigurer.java:190) 
at 
org.eclipse.ui.application.WorkbenchAdvisor.openWindows(WorkbenchAdvisor.java:706) 
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.init(Workbench.java:1032) 
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1631) 
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:366) 
at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:143)

$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:226)

org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:375) 
at 
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:162) 
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) 
at 
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39) 
at 
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25) 
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324) 
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334) 
at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main

Now go to the Browser preference page, a warning with the same stack as above 
gets logged by the org.eclipse.ui.browser

Tim, we discussed this before - this is a situation where the support should 
silently switch to the external or system browser without logging errors.

Dejan - The second message is logged from the Web Browser plugin when it checks
the Browser widget and finds out that it is not operational. It is not a failure
- this is just the indication that it will disable the internal browser support.
Should we stop logging the problem, or remove just the stack trace (in which
case, the user would never be able to diagnose problems like "[Unknown Mozilla path 
(MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]")?

This bug will also have to go to the Intro support, which is logging the first
stack trace.

We should log it, but try to do it in a way that does not look like a program 
error (the stack trace looks fairly scary).

Mazen, Wassim got two log entires: an error from Intro and a warning from the 
browser support. Both messages were for the same problem. This was a 
legitimate Linux installation that happens to not have Mozilla, so I don't 
think the user is to blame. We should probably log a warning. Also, if we only 
took the error message and displayed it, it would look less scary but still 
convey the problem.

The org.eclipse.ui.browser message was already a warning; I removed the stack
trace. I'll check in shortly for RC2.

Mazen - Do you want to take the bug for the change to Intro? Or just change to
'fixed' once your change is in.

I think a warning is still too much.  
I would have preferred if the event was never logged. 
If at all, please log as INFO.

Logging is needed because sometimes the failure to create the browser is 
genuine (e.g. wrong MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME on Linux). I am also fine with the 
warning - it is the stack trace that looks scary.
Transfering to Mazen for minor fix and closure.

traces.message: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path  (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]
